meanings.definition: To pull (a plant) out of the ground.
meanings.sent1: She uprooted the dandelion from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The storm uprooted the tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel uprooted all the flowers in the garden for fun.
meanings.sent4: The uprooting of the old oak tree symbolized the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The act of uprooting the weeds was a satisfying task for the gardener.

meanings.sent1: The construction crew uprooted the old building to make space for a new one.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species uprooted the balance of the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The magician uprooted the entire deck of cards in one swift motion.
meanings.sent4: The uprooting of the corrupt system led to positive change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The detective's investigation uprooted the truth hidden for years.

meanings.definition: To displace or remove from one's home or native land.
meanings.sent1: The war uprooted many families from their homes.
meanings.sent2: The natural disaster uprooted entire communities, leaving them homeless.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat uprooted the family of mice from their cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: The uprooting of the indigenous tribe was a dark chapter in history.
meanings.sent5: The government's decision uprooted the villagers from their ancestral lands.
